title: Bears' Jake Moody connects on field goal as time expires to beat Commanders
content: With Cairo Santos sidelined, Moody was activated before the game and came up big when it mattered most.

title: Snell joins elite company as Dodgers take opener
content: Blake Snell led the Dodgers to a 2-1 Game 1 victory in the NLCS against the Brewers, pitching his way into the kind of company he knew he'd be keeping when he signed with L.A. before the season.

title: Brewers turn MLB's 1st playoff 8-6-2 double play
content: The Brewers pulled off the first 8-6-2 double play in MLB postseason history against the Dodgers in Game 1 of the NLCS on Monday night.

title: QB Penix: Win over Bills shows Falcons are 'legit'
content: The Falcons showed they were a "legit" playoff contender after a 24-14 win over the Bills on Monday Night Football

title: M's take two in Toronto for commanding ALCS lead
content: Julio Rodriguez and Jorge Polanco each hit three-run homers as the Seattle Mariners drew to within two wins of the franchise's first World Series appearance.

title: Titans fire Callahan, to give McCoy shot at job
content: The Titans have fired Brian Callahan just six games into his second season as the team's head coach. He finishes with a 4-19 record as the team's coach.

title: McDermott: Bills must use bye week to start over
content: With Monday night's loss to the Falcons, the banged-up Bills enter their bye week on a two-game losing streak after a 4-0 start.

title: Lions safety Branch suspended 1 game for fight
content: The NFL has suspended Lions safety Brian Branch for one game without pay after he struck Chiefs wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster and set off a brief fight.

title: Sources: NBA OK'd Clips' Aspiration patch deal
content: The NBA vetted and approved a $300 million sponsorship deal between the Los Angeles Clippers and Aspiration in 2021, before the company signed a separate deal with Kawhi Leonard that triggered an investigation by the league, multiple sources told ESPN.

title: Passan: Jorge Polanco has the Mariners on the way to a Hollywood ending
content: Harry Potter, Iceman ... or George Bonds? Whatever you call him, Jorge Polanco has the Mariners rolling.

title: WNBA's CBA negotiations: Everything to know with deadline looming
content: The CBA expires Oct. 31. Here are the biggest issues and how WNBA players' criticisms of Cathy Engelbert might impact negotiations.

title: NBA big-three tiers: Ranking core trios for all 30 teams
content: Who has the top core trio in the NBA? Which teams' big threes are on the rise, and which need work? ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks it down in 10 tiers.

title: AP men's hoops preseason poll: Breaking down all Top 25 teams
content: Here's what to know about each team in the AP men's preseason Top 25, from No. 1 Purdue to No. 25 North Carolina.

title: The rise of Curt Cignetti, the fall of James Franklin and other midseason thoughts
content: Bill Connelly looks at both ends of the coaching world, plus the top players, the Heisman race and more.

title: Checking the temperature of the NFL's hottest seats: Barnwell on Mike McDaniel, Justin Fields
content: Should the Dolphins or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

title: Takeaways from Week 6: Robinson shines for Falcons, Moody kicks Bears to victory
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

title: How USMNT, USWNT choose opponents, venues and prices for games
content: USMNT and USWNT fans often complain about high ticket prices, repetitive cities and weak opponents for games, but U.S. Soccer explains everything that goes into such decisions.

title: Pickups: Vidal steps up; Dart, Darnold being underrated
content: Highlighting free agent options after some big performances this weekend and to help with injury concerns ahead of Week 7.

title: Buzz from Sunday: Nacua, Egbuka injuries and a peek at Moody's game notes
content: Stephania Bell takes a closer look at the injuries from Sunday; Eric Moody shares his most interesting notes.

title: Penn State fires James Franklin: Top candidates, transfers and recruits
content: After two shocking losses, Penn State is looking for a new coach. The job quickly becomes the best in this cycle.

title: Who is going to the World Series? Expert predictions for ALCS, NLCS
content: The Dodgers, Brewers, Blue Jays and Mariners remain. Here's who we think will move on -- and how our playoff predictions have fared so far.

title: Fantasy hockey pickups: Zeev Buium's power-play success leads defensemen
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: First bets for Week 7: Buccaneers' luck runs out vs. Lions, Giants cover in Denver
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: The Vision is blurred
content: Seth Rollins was blindsided when The Vision teammates Bron Breakker and Bronson Reed betrayed him at 'Raw.'

title: NFL Week 6's top performance? Check the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award leaderboard
content: Patrick Mahomes, Baker Mayfield, Drake Maye or Rico Dowdle -- only one of them could win Week 6's "Himmy" Award.

title: Premier League big issues: Will Amorim, Ange last? Is Salah a fading force?
content: The Premier League returns this weekend. With four matchdays until the next international break, what are the big issues looming over the next month?

title: Dutch-born players are making Suriname's World Cup dreams a reality
content: Due to a change in FIFA rules, Suriname is drawing on its Dutch lineage to earn a spot in the 2026 World Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan focused on Liverpool's Joe Gomez
content: AC Milan want to sign an experienced center back, and Liverpool's Joe Gomez is their main target. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Haryana IPS officer’s suicide: Nayab govt’s 1-yr celebration put on hold
content: A major rally in Sonipat celebrating one year of the Nayab Singh Saini government, which was to feature Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has been postponed. The decision comes amid escalating tensions and protests following the alleged casteist harassment leading to the suicide of IPS officer Y Puran Kumar.

title: Bihar polls: JD(U) MLA sits outside CM Nitish's house over ticket; refuses to move
content: A JD(U) MLA staged a protest outside Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's residence, demanding an election ticket for Gopalpur. The legislator, known for past controversies including a train incident and accusations against a deputy CM, vowed not to leave without securing the nomination. This action highlights internal party tensions amid seat-sharing finalizations.

title: IPS officer ‘suicide’ case: Senior officer OP Singh appointed new Haryana DGP
content: Amid the ongoing controversy surrounding the death of IPS Y Puran Kumar, who allegedly died by suicide at his Chandigarh residence on October 7, Haryana Director-General of Police (DGP) Shatrujeet Kapur has been placed on leave, sources said.

title: 'You look great, but stop smoking!': Erdogan tells Meloni at peace talks
content: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan playfully urged Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni to quit smoking during a peace summit in Egypt. Despite French President Macron's skepticism, Erdogan reiterated Turkey's commitment to a smoke-free future, even on the sidelines of international diplomacy.

title: Cyber war alert: NSE hit by 40cr attacks in a day during Op Sindoor; AI used
content: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) combats an estimated 170 million daily cyberattacks with a dedicated team and advanced systems. During 'Operation Sindoor,' the exchange successfully repelled a record 400 million attacks, showcasing its robust defense mechanisms against threats like DDoS. This highlights the critical need for continuous investment in cyber defense to protect financial market infrastructure.

title: Bihar seat sharing: Lalu jumps gun, distributes tickets to RJD leaders
content: Despite the approaching nomination deadline for Bihar assembly elections, the Mahagathbandhan has not yet finalized its seat-sharing deal. RJD patriarch Lalu Prasad Yadav has begun distributing party tickets to favored candidates, including prominent leaders who switched parties. This move follows a similar pattern from the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, where RJD also announced candidates before a formal agreement.

title: Latest WTC standings: India inflict clean sweep on Indies; where do they stand now?
content: India completed a dominant 2-0 series sweep against the West Indies in the second Test, comfortably chasing down 121 runs with eight wickets in hand. Despite a resilient West Indies batting performance, India's bowlers secured the victory, though they remain third in the World Test Championship standings.

title: Meta AI hiring spree: Mira Murati’s lab founder poached; firm confirms exit
content: Thinking Machines Lab, co-founded by Mira Murati, has lost co-founder Andrew Tulloch to Meta Platforms. Tulloch, a former Meta employee and AI researcher, rejoined Mark Zuckerberg's expanding AI division after a brief period at the startup.  Thinking Machines Lab stated they remain focused on their mission despite this departure.

title: Tamil Nadu caste killing: 3 months after marriage, man hacked by father-in-law
content: A 24-year-old man, Ramachandran, was allegedly hacked to death by his father-in-law in Dindigul district, three months after marrying against her family's wishes. The victim's wife claims her entire family was involved, but only her father has been arrested. Police are investigating further into the suspected caste killing.

title: South Asian University student 'sexually assaulted' by 4
content: A female student at South Asian University has alleged sexual assault on campus, with a security guard, staff member, and two students reportedly involved. The university has formed a probe committee. Separately, an MBBS student in Adarsh Nagar reported being raped at a hotel after being drugged and confined. Investigations are underway in both cases.

title: Woman jumps into well after fight, rescuer descends, lover leans, wall collapses; trio dies
content: A tragic well collapse in Kollam claimed the lives of a fire officer and two others during a rescue attempt. The incident occurred after a woman jumped into the well following a dispute with her lover. The wall collapsed while the rescue was underway, trapping all three.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor’s WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho’s Arattai
content: India's Supreme Court has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. The court dismissed a doctor's plea to restore her blocked account, emphasizing users must adhere to platform policies. It suggested alternatives like Zoho's Arattai app, which has seen a surge in popularity.

title: LG Electronics India makes solid stock market debut at 50% premium
content: LG Electronics India has successfully listed on the BSE and NSE today. The company's Initial Public Offering saw immense investor interest, becoming the second most subscribed issue ever. Experts anticipate strong investor demand for the stock, citing attractive valuations and solid business prospects. LG Electronics India reported robust financial performance in FY25, with significant growth in revenue and profit.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: DGP Shatrujeet sent on forced leave after midnight call
content: Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Kapur has been sent on leave following the suicide of IPS officer Y Puran Kumar. The decision came after mounting pressure from the deceased officer's wife and Dalit groups, who demanded Kapur's removal. This development also led to the postponement of a government anniversary rally.

title: Gaza truce: Trump talks about 'Abraham Accords' in Middle East- what it means
content: US President Donald Trump highlighted the Abraham Accords during his Middle East visit, aiming to broaden Israel's diplomatic ties with Arab nations. The accords, named after a patriarch revered by three major faiths, underscore a shared heritage that has historically fueled conflict but now symbolizes unity. This initiative navigates the enduring tensions of Abraham's narrative, emphasizing coexistence.

title: Weeks after mother's demise, Khan Saab's father Iqbal Muhammad passes away
content: Punjabi singer Khan Saab has lost his father, Iqbat Muhammad, just weeks after his mother's passing. Iqbat Muhammad passed away at 63 due to a heart attack, with his funeral scheduled for today. The tragic news has deeply saddened the Punjabi music fraternity, with many artists sharing their condolences and offering support to Khan Saab during this difficult time.

title: 7 reasons for sugar cravings and practical ways to control them
content: Sugar cravings often stem from diet, stress, or poor sleep, impacting brain chemistry and emotions. Understanding triggers like habitual intake, inadequate nutrition, artificial sweeteners, and hormonal shifts is key. Implementing balanced meals, stress management, and better sleep can help regain control and foster healthier eating habits for overall well-being.

title: How a sister’s courage helped police nab main accused in Durgapur gang-rape case
content: In a significant development, the elder sister of a key accused in the Durgapur gang-rape case aided police in apprehending her brother, Safiq Sk.  Another accused, Sk Nasiruddin, was also arrested, bringing all five perpetrators into custody. The victim, a medical student, was attacked near her college.  Authorities are pursuing swift justice for the survivor.

title: IRCTC introduces new rule: Change your train date without penalty
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce a passenger-friendly change allowing confirmed ticket holders to reschedule journeys without cancellation charges. Travellers will be able to modify their travel date via the IRCTC portal, paying only the fare difference, making train travel more flexible and affordable for those with changing plans.

title: 'Worst violator': India slams 'highly hypocritical' Pakistan at UN
content: India has accused Pakistan of violating the UN's Children and Armed Conflict agenda through attacks in Afghanistan and India. BJP MP Nishikant Dubey highlighted Pakistan's alleged abuses against children within its borders and ongoing cross-border terrorism. He condemned Pakistan's actions, calling its international statements hypocritical and urging it to protect its own children.

title: Apart from Coldrif, WHO flags Respifresh TR and ReLife as contaminated drugs
content: Following child deaths linked to contaminated cough syrups in India, the WHO has warned of potential export risks via unregulated channels. While India's drug regulator confirmed diethylene glycol in some products, it stated none were exported. Karnataka conducted random checks and found no substandard cough syrups, banning suspected contaminated products.

title: Kochi convent school closes for 2 days after student barred from wearing hijab
content: Tension erupted at St Rita's Public School after an eighth-grader was barred for wearing a hijab, violating uniform rules. The school lodged a police complaint and approached the high court for protection, declaring holidays. The girl's parents filed a complaint with the chief minister, with the father stating he will seek admission elsewhere.

title: 'Rahiman dhaaga prem ka ... ': Politics takes a poetic turn in Bihar's opposition camp
content: Seat sharing talks in Bihar's Mahagathbandhan are ongoing. Allies are negotiating for maximum seats. RJD and Congress leaders have exchanged poetic messages hinting at unease. Final seat distribution is being worked out. Candidates' lists and a joint manifesto are expected soon. Preparations for the first phase of polling are underway.

title: Trump calls Meloni ‘beautiful’, reveals why he avoids the word in the US
content: Donald Trump's public compliment to Italian PM Giorgia Meloni as "beautiful" at a right-wing gathering sparked debate. Trump acknowledged the remark could be controversial in the US, highlighting cultural differences in political discourse. Meloni appeared unfazed, focusing on leadership and conservative values. This incident underscores Trump's controversial style and its global implications.

title: Cape Verde, 815-time smaller than India, qualify for WC: Book first-ever spot
content: Cape Verde has achieved a historic first by qualifying for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, defeating Eswatini 3-0 to secure their spot. The Blue Sharks dominated their group, with goals from Livramento, Semedo, and Stopira sparking widespread celebrations. This remarkable achievement, coinciding with the nation's 50th independence anniversary, marks a significant milestone for the island nation.

title: In troubled waters: DLF Promenade, Emporio, Ambience Mall hit by shortage
content: South Delhi's prominent Vasant Kunj malls are grappling with a severe water shortage, forcing them to shut half their washroom facilities. This crisis stems from a ban on private water tankers, reportedly supplying from illegal borewells, following a National Green Tribunal order.

title: Bengaluru: Class 12 student jumps to death; father says son upset over homework
content: Tragedy struck Bengaluru's Clarence High School as a Class 12 student allegedly died by suicide from the second floor. The student, identified as Aaryan Moses Vyas, was reportedly distressed over homework issues, according to his father's complaint. The school mourned the loss of an exceptional student and sportsperson, offering counselling services to students and staff.

title: Trump asks Pak PM to say 'few words'; Sharif parrots ceasefire claim
content: US President Donald Trump unexpectedly invited Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to speak at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit on Gaza. Sharif lauded Trump as a "man of peace," praising his efforts in achieving a Gaza ceasefire and previously de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: 'India is a great country': Trump lauds 'friend' PM Modi in Gaza peace summit
content: US President Donald Trump praised Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "very good friend" at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit, expressing optimism for improved India-Pakistan relations.  The remarks followed a historic peace agreement for Gaza, with both leaders discussing trade progress and Trump inviting Pakistan's PM to speak.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 25,300; BSE Sensex up over 180 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 25,300, BSE Sensex was up over 180 points.

title: IND vs AUS: Gill given candid advice - 'Don’t stress over Rohit and Virat'
content: Former wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel advised Shubman Gill against managing seniors Kohli and Sharma, citing their maturity. He believes both veterans can maintain form despite fewer ODIs by playing domestic tournaments like the Vijay Hazare Trophy, which keeps them match-fit and benefits their game, ultimately aiding the Indian team.

title: Palestinian influencer Saleh al-Jafarawi killed in Gaza
content: Gaza influencer Saleh al-Jafarawi, known as 'Mr FAFO,' reportedly died amid factional clashes. He gained notoriety for celebrating the October 7th attack and later faced accusations of misappropriating donation funds. His death has sparked mixed reactions, with Israelis viewing him as a propagandist and pro-Palestinian activists mourning a documented voice of struggle.

title: Bhopal road collapse: Massive 30-feet crater swallows lane
content: A 100-meter road section near Sukhi Sevania, Bhopal, caved in Monday afternoon, narrowly avoiding a major accident due to no traffic. Authorities have closed the road and initiated a probe into the incident. Separately, an auto-rickshaw driver died after his vehicle was rammed by an unidentified vehicle in Govindpura.

title: Trump-Xi meeting still on! 'Substantial communication' between US-China; What's next?
content: Despite escalating trade tensions, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent remains optimistic about a meeting between Presidents Trump and Xi in South Korea. He stated that substantial communication occurred over the weekend following China's imposition of rare-earth export controls. Bessent emphasized that the US will not accept these restrictions and is seeking global support to de-escalate the situation.

title: Texas lift-off to Indian Ocean splash: Starship completes test flight- watch
content: SpaceX's Starship rocket completed a significant test flight, traveling halfway around the globe and deploying mock satellites before landing in the Indian Ocean. This eleventh mission, crucial for NASA's lunar landing goals by 2030, saw the massive rocket successfully separate its booster and test entry procedures over the ocean.

title: ‘Fight to the end’: China warns against Trump’s 100% tariffs; ‘door open’ for negotiation
content: China has issued a strong warning to the US, declaring readiness to 'fight to the end' amidst escalating trade tensions. This comes after the US imposed a 100% tariff on Chinese imports, bringing the total to 130%.

title: Ramiz Raja mocks 39-year-old Pakistan spinner over his dressing sense
content: Former Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja commented on spinner Noman Ali's sunglasses during the first Test against South Africa. Noman Ali took four wickets on a turning pitch. South Africa fought back, with De Zorzi batting strongly. Spinners dominated the day's play, with both sides' slow bowlers claiming wickets. The match is poised for an exciting conclusion.

title: 'You don’t mind right?': Trump calls Meloni 'beautiful young woman' in Gaza summit
content: At the Gaza Peace Summit, US President Donald Trump complimented Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's appearance, calling her a "beautiful young woman." He then praised her political success and effectiveness.

title: Did Patrick Mahomes boycott Bad Bunny for Charlie Kirk? Truth revealed
content: Viral claims that Patrick Mahomes would boycott the 2026 Super Bowl over Bad Bunny's halftime show and join Turning Point USA are false. Mahomes has made no such statements regarding Bad Bunny or the political group. His wife, Brittany, made a general comment about hate after Charlie Kirk's death, but Mahomes himself remains apolitical.

title: Indian-origin Subu Vedam arrested by ICE moments after release; to be deported
content: An Indian-origin man in Pennsylvania, freed after 43 years for a murder he didn't commit, was immediately detained by ICE on a decades-old deportation order. Subramanyam Vedam, who arrived in the US as an infant, faces deportation to India, a country he barely knows. His family is protesting, highlighting his wrongful conviction.

title: Josh Allen reveals he cried watching Hailee Steinfeld’s scenes in ‘Sinners’
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen shared his deep admiration for his wife Hailee Steinfeld's acting in her new film 'Sinners'. Allen admitted to becoming emotional watching Steinfeld's performance, highlighting his pride in her talent. The couple, married in May 2025, skillfully balance their demanding careers. Steinfeld often adjusts her schedule to support Allen's NFL season, demonstrating their mutual dedication.

title: Massive mail theft in Canada: Details of 344 charges against 8 Indian-origin men
content: Eight Punjabi men face numerous charges following a joint police and Canada Post investigation into a $400,000 mail theft operation. Authorities recovered hundreds of stolen items, including gift cards, credit cards, and government IDs, from residences in Mississauga.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta suggests buying Shree Cement and Hindalco today. Shree Cement is poised for an uptrend after consolidation above its 200-day moving average. Hindalco, forming a triangle pattern, is expected to continue its upward movement after finding support at its 10-day moving average.

title: Hidden detail in Brittany Mahomes’ game-day outfit stuns Chiefs fans
content: Patrick Mahomes shone on the field, but his wife Brittany Mahomes captured attention with a stylish outfit featuring a hidden detail. Her pants showcased a vintage Kansas City Chiefs game ticket print, a personal touch revealed on Instagram. This fashion-forward move, blending team pride with unique flair, cemented her status as a notable sports influencer.

title: Stones hurled at Shia cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad in Lucknow
content: Shia cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad and his supporters staged a protest at the site, accusing police of negligence

title: 4-storey chemical factory in Indore gutted in fire; no casualty
content: Fire officer Vinod Mishra said the blaze was so severe that fire engines and firefighters were called in from Indore as well as nearby towns like Depalpur, Betma, Mhow, Pithampur and Sanwer to control it.

title: MP Mallu Ravi urges PM for committee to identify systemic challenges faced by Dalits
content: The Congress MP also urged for action against those responsible for the incidents and a review of institutional safeguards

title: Passenger injured in stone-pelting at train in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Passenger suffers hand injury when a stone struck him while he was seated by the window. The display screen of his mobile phone is also damaged

title: After Transport Minister faces aggressive honking, Kerala launches Statewide crackdown on high-decibel air horns
content: Minister Ganesh Kumar orders MVD officials to confiscate air horns from vehicles and destroy them publicly to send a clear message to wrongdoers

title: Watch: India’s unsung forest heroes: the Van Rakshaks protecting our wild
content: A new Wildlife Trust of India report, “Guardians of the Wild,” highlights the courage and sacrifices of Van Rakshaks, the nation’s frontline forest guards. Guarding over 1,100 Protected Areas, these rangers work under dangerous and under-equipped conditions, with India recording the world’s highest number of forest staff fatalities. Released at the IUCN World Conservation Congress in Abu Dhabi, the report is a call to recognise and protect those who guard India’s forests, the true guardians of the wild

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly adopts resolution mourning Karur stampede victims
content: The House also adopts condolence resolutions mourning the passing of Achuthanandan, Soren, Ganesan, Reddy, and others

title: Durgapur gang rape: Police to take five arrested accused to crime spot for reconstruction of crime
content: The arrested persons would be taken to the crime spot in the jungle adjacent to Paranaganj Kali Bari cremation ground, which is close to the gates of the private medical college

title: WazirX restructuring scheme officially approved by Singapore High Court
content: The news is a source of relief for many distraught Indian investors whose locked up crypto assets are stuck with the exchange, while others are pushing for WazirX operations to resume quickly

title: Achieving Centre’s rooftop solar targets to remain a challenge: study
content: As of July 2025 – until which the report tracked progress – the PMSGY had 57.9 lakh applications for residential rooftop solar installations

title: South Asian University student sexually assaulted in Delhi, FIR registered
content: The matter is being investigated with due sensitivity and priority, said the Deputy Commissioner of Police (South)

title: Sonam Wangchuk case LIVE: Supreme Court to hear wife Gitanjali Angmo’s plea
content: In its last hearing, the Supreme Court orally asked the Union government to consider sharing the grounds of preventive detention of climate activist Sonam Wangchuk with his wife

title: Dharwad district secretary upset with delay in preparing project estimate, orders issue of show cause notice to executive engineer
content: Ram Prasath Manohar takes serious exception to failure of executive engineer of Panchayat Raj Engineering Department

title: Tension at Peralassery in Kerala’s Kannur as bomb thrown at woman’s house linked to BJP office
content: The attack occurred ahead of scheduled inauguration of BJP office on Peralassery temple road on Wednesday

title: At UNGA, Nishikant Dubey slams Pakistan over child rights violations
content: The BJP MP described Pakistan as "one of the worst violators of the UN's CAC (Children and Armed Conflict) agenda" and pointed out serious issues not just within Pakistan but also in neighbouring regions

title: Odisha CM assures Durgapur gang rape survivor of full support
content: The Chief Minister also spoke to the survivor's mother and Odisha State Commission for Women (OSCW) chairperson Shovana Mohanty, who was present at the hospital

title: Electricity consumers’ convention to be held in Bengaluru on October 26
content: All India Electricity Consumers’ Association (AIECA) has organised South India zone electricity consumers’ convention in Bengaluru on October 26, opposing privatisation of power sector and to press for various demands

title: WHO issues medical product alert on three contaminated oral liquid medicines in India
content: The contaminated oral liquid medicines have been identified to be specific batches of COLDRIF, Respifresh TR and ReLife, manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, Rednex Pharmaceuticals, and Shape Pharma

title: Militant arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested an active cadre of the proscribed Kangleipak Communist Party (PWG) outfit from Patsoi area in Imphal West district. He has been identified as 24-year-old Naorem Thembung, a police statement said

title: TDP MLA demands SIT probe into murder of suspended JSP leader’s driver in Srikalahasti
content: Expressing suspicion over the veracity of a ‘selfie video’ of the deceased, Venkata Sudheer Reddy says that it could have been generated by using computer graphics or AI tools

title: Rajasthan’s conviction rate up 18% after implementation of new laws, says Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the three laws would bring “ease of justice” with the reforms in the criminal justice system and a shift in focus away from the punitive approach

title: Haryana IPS officer death: DGP Shatrujeet Kapur sent on leave; additional charge given to Om Parkash
content: Rajiv Jaitly, media adviser to the Haryana chief minister, confirmed the development to The Hindu on Tuesday. “The DGP has been sent on leave. The formal order would be out soon,” he said

title: Bihar Assembly Elections LIVE: Lalu begins RJD ticket distribution, pauses after Tejashwi steps in
content: As the air remained thick with anticipation, aspirants, who apparently received phone calls from the party, began pouring in, only to emerge minutes later with the party symbol in their hands and a broad smile on their faces.

title: NITI Aayog report moots policy changes for fisheries sector
content: All subsidies should be kept to a minimum, applied for a limited period, and phased out as soon as possible, the report on ‘India’s Blue Economy: Strategy for Harnessing Deep-Sea and Offshore Fisheries’ said

title: Bhubaneswar has stray dogs significantly higher than national average
content: As per census outcome, there are currently 47,126 stray dogs in Bhubaneswar - 36 per 1000 human against national average of 11

title: Nearly 57,000 institutes yet to survey student suicides, mental health on campuses
content: The National Task Force was constituted by the Court earlier this year after the parents of multiple students who had died by suicide approached the Supreme Court of India

title: ‘India endowed with 95 minerals, but yet to establish a footprint in critical minerals’
content: Prof Subramanian said, IISc has successfully translated basic research around critical minerals into industry-scale solutions

title: Final hearing on December 4 on PIL plea against ban on books: J&K High Court
content: Bench tells CPI(M) leader Tarigami: “Most people would not understand the issue. How would you know that all the people are concerned? So, no notices will be issued”

title: Our early warning systems are not luxury but strategic investments, says India at G20 meet on disaster risk reduction
content: Principal Secretary to Prime Minister P.K. Mishra says India’s multi-agency architecture on disaster risk alerts has already issued over 109 billion alerts.

title: Naidu invites Modi for ‘Super GST – Super Savings’ event in Kurnool and CII Partnership Summit in Vizag
content: The Prime Minister’s participation in the CII Partnership Summit 2025 will inspire investors to strengthen India’s economic resurgence, says the Chief Minister

title: Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh attends Gaza Peace Summit, reaffirms India's support for peace plan
content: The Gaza peace summit was co-hosted by U.S. President Donald Trump and Egyptian President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi and was joined by several world leaders

title: In a show of strength in Eknath Shinde’s fortress, Shiv Sena UBT and MNS hold a joint rally in Thane
content: Both parties, along with Sharad Pawar’s NCP, staged a protest against alleged corruption and mismanagement in Thane Municipal Corporation

title: India-Australia joint military exercise AUSTRAHIND begins in Perth
content: Being held from October 13 to 26, this year’s edition focuses on counter-terrorism operations in urban and semi-urban terrain, reflecting the evolving nature of modern conflict, says the Indian Army.

title: Bulk LPG transporters strike: oil marketing companies continue to manage supplies in State
content: A senior official of an OMC says the is no need to panic as all three companies have enough cylinders in stock

title: Hyderabad’s revamped ‘corporate-style’ government school turning heads
content: Built at a cost of ₹7.7 crore, the new-look Government Primary and High School at Irrum Manzil stands out with its sleek architecture, landscaped surroundings, and modern facilities

title: Congress to boycott JPC on Bills to sack PM, CMs
content: The Lok Sabha had passed a resolution to refer the bills to the joint committee soon after Union Home Minister Amit Shah had introduced the bill in the Lower House on August 20

title: Singur land meant for defenceless people: Supreme Court
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi clarifies the scope of the court’s 2016 ruling in Kedar Nath Yadav v. State of West Bengal, which had quashed the acquisition proceedings for the Tata Motors plant and directed that the land be returned to its original owners within 12 weeks

title: Afghan Hindus, Sikhs meet Muttaqi, urge restoration of religious places
content: Community members requested the Taliban government to consider appointing Afghan Hindus or Sikhs at their mission in India to strengthen bilateral ties

title: Hike in PF pension under consideration of Cabinet: Minister
content: To enhance ease of living of EPF members, CBT decided to simplify the partial withdrawal provisions of EPF Scheme by merging 13 complex provisions into a single, streamlined rule categorised into three types namely, Essential Needs (illness, education, marriage), Housing Needs, and Special Circumstances

title: Congress questions omission of reference to RSS in FIR registered over Kerala IT professional’s death
content: A note that surfaced on his social media account had alleged sexual abuse in camps organised by the RSS; the organisation too has called for a probe into his death, calling the incident ‘sad and unfortunate’

title: Asian, African countries keen to emulate Kochi Water Metro
content: Kochi Water Metro Limited awaiting Euro 24 million additional loan from German lending agency KfW to extend operations

title: Supreme Court seeks Centre’s response on status of implementation of 2017 palliative care guidelines
content: Petition has sought directions to make palliative care accessible to terminally ill persons as part of national health programme

title: Notorious criminal shot dead in police encounter in Meerut
content: Shahzad, who had been evading arrest for nine months, had seven cases registered against him, including charges of rape

title: Most Ministers attend dinner meeting with Karnataka CM, speak one-on-one with him
content: The Chief Minister is reportedly keen on undertaking a reshuffle to mark the completion of half of the government’s five-year term in November

title: Tej Pratap Yadav announces 21 JJD candidates
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav’s estranged older son, founder of the Janshakti Janata Dal, also announced his own candidature from the Mahua Assembly seat

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin inaugurates mega food parks in Villupuram, Theni districts
content: The Chief Minister also opens Aran Illams — homes for transpersons established in Shenoy Nagar in Chennai and in Anna Nagar in Madurai at ₹43 lakh

title: Government will build a sports city with international standards at Amaravati, says Home Minister
content: Inaugurates national-level police weightlifting competition, which will see 32 teams from different States and Union Territories participating in the five-day evet

title: ‘Congress seeks 70 seats, RJD offers 58’; discussions drag on in Mahagatbandhan
content: RJD’s chief holds two rounds of meeting with Congress leadership in Delhi but fails to break the deadlock; Congress insisting on 70 seats that it fought in 2020; RJD argues that with more constituents in grand alliance

title: Bhutan should compensate for North Bengal floods, says Mamata
content: West Bengal Chief Minister reiterates demand for setting up Indo-Bhutan Joint River Commission, says State officials will attend meeting scheduled on October 16

title: Number of births declines; deaths rise slightly: report
content: There were 2.52 crore births in 2023, around 2.32 lakh fewer than in 2022. The Vital Statistics of India based on Civil Registration System (CRS) report for the year 2023 shows 86.6 lakh deaths were registered in 2023, a marginal increase from 86.5 lakh deaths in 2022.

title: Supreme Court refuses to quash FIR against folk singer for posts on PM
content: The court said it was not inclined to interfere at this stage but clarified that the singer could raise her objections when charges are framed before the trial court

title: Kashmir’s Baramulla district bans use of drones after Army raises alarm
content: The Army has expressed fears following intelligence inputs that there was a possibility that drones would be smuggled into the Kashmir Valley

title: With women’s vote proving decisive, NDA goes all out to garner support
content: The lessons of the previous Assembly election and the 2024 Lok Sabha polls are very much on the minds of poll strategists in the ruling alliance; with women considered a particularly ‘casteless’ voting bloc, it is little wonder that the NDA govt. in the State has rolled out schemes targeted at them

title: Idol Wing steps up efforts to recover three idols from U.K., Netherlands, and Singapore
content: The Idol Wing has been corresponding with foreign museums, the Union Ministry of Culture, and the respective foreign offices to recover the idols of Thirumangai Alwar, Kannappa Nayanar, and Hanuman

title: Bihar Court issues summonses to Rahul, Tejashwi over hurling of 'abuse' at PM Modi
content: The CJM has ordered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, RJD’s Tejashwi Yadav, and Mukesh Sahani of the Vikassheel Insaan Party to appear before the court in person or through their legal representatives on November 26

title: Haryana IPS officer death: Authorities meet officer’s wife over autopsy
content: The SIT probing the case has sent a letter to the deceased officer’s wife, requesting her “to come forward for identification of the body for the conduct of the PME (postmortem) at the earliest”

title: CM Pinarayi rejects media reports of ED summoning his son in 2023 on suspicion of money laundering
content: Pinarayi says adverse newspaper headlines and accusatory news chyrons on television channels will not deter him from taking the derogatory allegations aimed at causing him political and reputational damage head-on

title: B-SMILE drafts DPRs for 13 elevated corridors in Bengaluru worth ₹18,000 crore
content: The initial proposal, submitted to the government in 2024, included building elevated corridors covering 110 km, estimated to cost around ₹13,200 crore, excluding land acquisition

title: Poll Symbols Given To RJD Leaders By Lalu Yadav Recalled After Tejashwi Returns
content: In a surprise late-night development that has created a flutter in Bihar's political circles, leaders of the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), who were given party symbols for the Assembly polls yesterday evening, were recalled late at night

title: Haryana Top Cop Named In IPS Officer's Suicide Note Sent On Leave
content: The Haryana government has sent State DGP Shatrujeet Kapur on leave amid opposition's attack on the BJP dispensation over IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's alleged suicide.

title: Turkey's Erdogan Wants Italian PM Meloni To Stop Smoking. What She Said
content: While global leaders gathered to find a solution for broader Middle East peace, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan found a new target for his war on tobacco in Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni.

title: Won't Join Parliament Panel On Bills To Oust Jailed Ministers: Congress
content: Congress informed Kiren Rijiju that it, along with other opposition parties, will not be a part of joint committee of Parliament on three Bills that seek removal of top government functionaries under arrest for 30 consecutive days on serious charges

title: Hugs And Kisses: Divided By Hamas, Israeli Couple Reunites After 738 Days
content: When Avinatan Or entered his room at the Re'im crossing, he fell straight into the arms of his girlfriend, Noa Argamani, who was rescued by Israeli forces last year.

title: 2 Terrorists Killed By Security Forces During Infiltration Bid In J&K's Kupwara
content: Two terrorists were killed when the Indian Army foiled an infiltration bid on the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district.

title: "Hang My Head In Shame": Javed Akhtar On "Reception" Given To Taliban Minister In India
content: Amir Khan Muttaqi is currently on a six-day visit to India, the first such trip to the country by a Taliban leader since the group seized power in Afghanistan in 2021.

title: Delhi Boy, 5, Dies After Another Child Accidentally Runs E-Rickshaw Over Him
content: A five-year-old boy was killed after he was run over by an e-rickshaw that was accidentally started by another child while it was parked in a lane in south Delhi's Sangam Vihar area, an official said on Monday.

title: Maldives Becomes 1st To Eliminate Mother-To-Child Transmission Of Hepatitis
content: In a landmark public health achievement, the World Health Organisation has validated the Maldives for eliminating mother-to-child transmission of hepatitis B, while maintaining its earlier validation for HIV and syphilis.

title: 'Operation Sindoor Balanced Reply': India Slams Pakistan For Terrorism, Child Abuse At UN
content: India has slammed Pakistan at the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) for its grave violations of child rights and cross-border terrorism.

title: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire LIVE Updates: "It's Going To Hold Up", Says Trump On Gaza Truce
content: Israel Gaza Ceasefire LIVE Updates: US President Donald Trump and regional leaders signed a declaration Monday meant to cement a ceasefire in Gaza, hours after Israel and Hamas exchanged hostages and prisoners.

title: Schools Shut After Nearly 6,000 Students In Malaysia Infected With Influenza
content: Around 6,000 students in Malaysia have been infected with influenza and some schools have been closed for the safety of children and staff, an education ministry official said.

title: Video: Musk's SpaceX Rocket Booster Makes Planned Crash In Gulf Of Mexico
content: SpaceX launched another of its mammoth Starship rockets on a test flight Monday, striving to make it halfway around the world while releasing mock satellites like last time.

title: Pak Thought It Could Do Anything, But Op Sindoor Proved It Wrong: Defence Chief
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan on Monday asserted 'Operation Sindoor' against Pakistan in May created a "new matrix of decision and timing in warfare" and insisted a war is not fought by the armed forces alone, but by the entire nation.

title: US, China To Roll Out Tit-For-Tat Port Fees, Threatening More Turmoil At Sea
content: The United States and China on Tuesday will begin charging port fees on ocean shipping firms that move everything from holiday toys to crude oil, making the high seas a key front in the trade war between the world's two largest economies.

title: Hot Mic Captures Indonesia President Asking Trump For Meeting With Son Eric
content: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto asked U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday if he could meet with Trump's son Eric, according to comments by the leaders picked up by a microphone after Trump had addressed a Gaza-focused summit in Egypt.

title: Dating App Grindr Explores Go-Private Deal Amid Share Slump: Report
content: Insiders at dating app Grindr are discussing taking it private after a share slump put its top owners in a tight personal financial position, Semafor reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Shehbaz Sharif Behind Him, Trump Praises "Very Good Friend" PM Modi In Egypt
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday praised India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi without naming him, saying "India is a great country with a good friend of mine at the top".

title: One thing you shouldn't be surprised by ... for every NBA team
content: if he gets hurt again, we must reevaluate. PF/SF Jayson Tatum is out for much of the season . SG/PG Derrick White will see a career-best in shots .

title: J&K: Security forces kill two terrorists in Kupwara; foil infiltration bid
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .

title: Bijan Robinson fuels Falcons in MNF win against Bills
content: the Falcons beat the Buffalo Bills 24-14 at Mercedes-Benz Stadium . the team is the only team to do it more than once since the 1970 merger . it was the first time the team had 150 yards and a touchdown as teammates in their careers .

title: An NBA dynasty reborn? Why the Warriors could be more dangerous than you think
content: the Golden State Warriors have just the seventh-best odds to win the West this season . they are behind the defending champions Oklahoma City Thunder, Denver Nuggets, Houston Rockets , los Angeles Lakers , Minnesota Timberwolves and LA Clippers . if Buddy Hield joins Stephen Curry , Jimmy Butler III , Draymond Green and Al Horford in the starting lineup .

title: What does Brian Callahan's firing mean for Cam Ward, 1-5 Titans?
content: the Titans hired the former Cincinnati Bengals offensive coordinator in January 2024 . callahan worked with the likes of peyton Manning, Matthew Stafford , Derek Carr and Joe Burrow . he finished with a 3-14 record in his first season with second-year quarterback Will Levis .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 at midseason: Buckeyes the team to beat
content: Ohio State has emerged as the clear favorite in "SportsCenter" at the midpoint of the season, Penn State has three losses . Texas is trying to claw its way back into the playoff conversation, and undefeated Indiana is a top five team . the battle for no. 1 is ongoing .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What final four must do to reach Fall Classic
content: the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Toronto Blue Jays will begin their series on the national league side of the bracket . the NL, Los Angeles rolled past the Philadelphia Phillies and Milwaukee edged the division rival Chicago Cubs for the final spot .

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Indiana climbs into top 3
content: Oklahoma can still make the playoffs even with a loss to Texas . Ohio State allowed a whopping 16 points at Illinois, seven more than it had in any other game this season . the most dominant team is looking for areas to improve as the midpoint of 2025 season arrives .

title: AP Week 7 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the top two teams in the poll stayed steady but there was movement not far below . then-no. 7 Indiana went to then no. 3 Oregon and notched a big win to declare themselves as legitimate national title contenders . Alabama and Ole Miss squeaked out wins . now they are atop the SEC alongside Texas A&M .

title: Woman from Manipur found dead in Munirka, partner critical
content: the deceased was identified as thempi Khongsai, a beautician by profession . her partner, Thangjam Viney Meitei, is undergoing treatment at AIIMS Trauma Centre . both were originally from manipur and were living together in a rented flat .

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: Cape Verde book first finals appearance
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage take place in October, when we will discover the seven nations joining Morocco and Tunisia .
